sub_title: Researcher @ Erasmus Centre for Entrepreneurship | Research Insights & Data Analysis | Cultural Economics
summary:
As a Researcher at Erasmus Centre for Entrepreneurship (ECE), I specialize in cultural entrepreneurship and female leadership, uncovering the latest research insights and trends in these domains. I also contribute to the data collection and analysis of the ScaleUp Dashboard and the European Scaleup Monitor, which provide valuable information on the scaleup ecosystem in the Netherlands and Europe.

I hold a master's degree in Cultural Economics & Entrepreneurship from Erasmus Universiteit Rotterdam, where I participated in various programs and courses related to creative entrepreneurship, impact assessment, and effective altruism. Previously, I worked as a Policy Trainee and Research Assistant at Culture Action Europe, where I advocated for the sustainability and resilience of the cultural and creative sectors in the EU. I am passionate about entrepreneurial practices, innovation, and social impact, and I aim to support and empower the cultural and creative industries through my research and advocacy work.

projects.title: Master’s Career Event IFA ACE
projects.description: The event’s purpose was to guide and advise Master’s students regarding pursuing a PhD at the Erasmus School of History, Culture and Communication (ESHCC), learn about working in an art fund from Amsterdams Fonds voor de Kunst (AFK), and meet & discuss with four International Master’s Alumni who succeed in the Dutch Cultural & Communication labor market, Angela Schoonderbeek, Maria Marshakova, Alen Evtimov & Tereza V. Krasteva

projects.title: Bachelor’s Career Event IFA ACE
projects.description: The one-day event hosted InterviewCompanion which offered a workshop of scientifically based job application advice and CV writing insights. Additionally, Natalie Iv and Andrea Carolina Ochoa Díaz, who as professionals in the creative and media sector provided insights and career advice to our participants.

projects.title: Career Days 2021 by IFA ACE
projects.description: The Career Days are bringing students of Erasmus University Rotterdam and companies closer together. During this 3-day event, students experienced business life with company presentations, cases, and workshops. Organized by ACE, Career Days inspired companies and students alike to think about their competencies and core talents.

authors.headline: Researcher @ Erasmus Centre for Entrepreneurship | Research Insights & Data Analysis | Cultural Economics

profile_positions.description:
- Data Colletion, Data Analysis & Co-editing of "SHE LEADS Dashboard 2022" & "SHE LEADS Dashboard 2023" and follow-up publications; SHE LEADS is an initiative that encourages female entrepreneurship and leadership by uncovering the latest research insights around the topic. It also promotes female representation in entrepreneurship education at Erasmus University Rotterdam. This project is supported by the Ondernemende Vrouwen Fonds and Jong Ondernemerschap Fonds of Erasmus Trustfonds.
- Data collection, analysis (quantitative research), and presentation of the "ScaleUp Dashboard 2022" and "European Scaleup Monitor 2022"; where new trends, facts and figures are researched in the scaleup ecosystem on a Dutch and European level, respectively. 
- Qualitative Research in the Entrepreneurial and Innovation Ecosystems of Zuid-Holland in the Maritime Cluster commissioned by InnovationQuarter. 
- EntreprenEURship Analytics for Erasmus University of Rotterdam (EUR); A proof of concept-reserach project assessing the entrepreneurial activity of EUR students
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Junior Researcher @Startups & Scaleups Research
- Data collection and analysis (quantitative & qualitative reserach) of the "Top 250 Scaleups 2022"; An Insights Report publication which sheds light on the growth journeys of some of the Dutch fastest-growing companies of 2022 together with the most interesting conclusions of our year-long research into Dutch and international scaleups.   
- Editorial Coordination of "SHE LEADS" publications; SHE LEADS in Creative Entrepreneurship & Spotlight publications
- Marketing & Communication support for social media and newsletter campaigns
profile_positions.title: Junior Project Member

profile_positions.description: CAE is the major European network of cultural networks, organizations, artists, activists, academics and policymakers. As a Policy Trainee, I conduct research, assist in projects, and keep track of the European developments for the cultural and creative sectors, especially about funding (#CulturalDealEU), working conditions of the artists (European Status of the Artist) and freedom of artistic expression. Furthermore, I have acquired editorial experience through the writing of many blogposts, newsdigests and a publication. A few of them are listed below:

profile_positions.title: Student Ambassador

profile_positions.description: As President of the Career Committee of I.F.A ACE, I had the honor to direct and coordinate the organization of three career events: the Career Days 2021, the Bachelor's Career Event, and the Master's Career Event with skillful and responsible Board & Committee members. The events were created by students - for students of the Erasmus School of History, Culture, and Communication aiming the connection of the latter with the labor market by creating (online) space for meaningful conversations, valuable insights, mentoring, and inspiration. Also, through this role, I acquired an additional knowledge of the Dutch cultural and creative ecosystem.
profile_positions.title: President of the Career Committee of IFA ACE

profile_positions.description:
The 1st event dedicated to people with disabilities. The cause of the event was to inform the public and stakeholders in Greece about the abilities of the disable and chronic patients, social entrepreneurship and prolepsis. As a Junior Project Manager at the event Unlimited Abilities Days by Humane my responsibilities were: 
-	Event management, logistics
-	Event organization to achieve its goals and follow-up 
-	Speaker / guest communication and hospitality management
-	Communication and sponsorship procedure management 
-	Registration process management 
-	Management/ coordination of the participants on the day of the event: visitors, speakers, sponsors booths, partners etc.
-	Cocreation of content for communication material, printed and electronic, as well as for the event material (program, accompanying material etc.)
profile_positions.title: Junior Project Manager
